title.narrative: 4.2.3 : EMERGENCY GBV

description.narrative: Survivors of GBV benefit from holistic assistance (medical, psychosocial, socio-economic and legal) and protection against all forms of violence, exploitation and abuse, according to the standard operating procedures., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The capacity of institutional and non-institutional protection actors is enhanced at the national and regional levels to enable them to provide gender-sensitive medical, psychosocial, legal, and livelihoods support and life skills training to vulnerable and sexually abused women and girls.

sector.narrative: Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Survivors of GBV benefit from holistic assistance (medical, psychosocial, socio-economic and legal) and protection against allforms of violence, exploitation and abuse, according to the standard operating procedures.

description.narrative: In 2017, a total of 939 GBV/SEA received a holistic assistance. Out of them, 282 SEA cases were registered as SEA allegedly committed by international forces, UN militaries and humanitarian actors during 2014 X 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018
